KnowledgeBase.Title: modi
KnowledgeBase.HumanKeywords: number arithmetic division mod remainder integer operators

Function.Description: The modi function divides two numbers and returns the remainder.

Brief.Overview: The modi function divides two numbers and returns the remainder. The modi function performs an integer divide, and the result is type Integer (See Native Types).
Brief.Usage: The modi function is analogous to the remainder function in other systems. It is useful for determining if a number will divide evenly into another number (the remainder will be zero in this case).

Argument.Name: dividend
Argument.Note: The number to be divided (will be converted to an integer before divide)

Argument.Name: divisor
Argument.Note: Divide by this number (will be converted to an integer before divide)

Syntax.Return: The remainder after computing an integer divide. The result is expressed as a number.
